intro: Byttneria scalpellata var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth byttneria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Nigeria and Ghana. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its dispersal in the wild.
